page.title: 07LAND COVER AND SPORT
page.content: The land to the west of the block is mainly rough grazing with sheep and some cattle. The area around the river is more fertile and is used to grow various crops; wheat, barley, potatoes, and hay. The eastern edge of the block is also wooded and is used for hatching and rearing pheasant for sport. Rough shooting takes place over most of the area. The following animals and birds are hunted: rabbits, hares, duck, geese, snipe, pheasant, and grouce. Fishing takes place on the Allan Water for trout and salmon. Fishing permits can be purchased for various stretches of water. There is also horse riding to be had in the area where the champion jockey, Willie Carson, learned to ride as a schoolboy.
